questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to define the main content of a webpage?
questions.explanation: The <body> tag contains all the visible content of an HTML page.

questions.question: What does the <title> tag do in an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The <title> tag defines the title that appears in the browser's title bar or tab.

questions.question: Which HTML tag is used to make text bold?
questions.explanation: The <b> tag is used to display text in bold.

questions.question: What file extension should an HTML file have?
questions.explanation: HTML files typically use the .htm or .html extension.

questions.question: According to the briefing, what type of editor should NOT be used to create HTML documents?
questions.explanation: Word processors often add formatting that interferes with HTML code.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <head> section in an HTML document?
options: B) Contains metadata about the document
questions.explanation: The <head> section contains information about the HTML document, such as the title, which is not displayed directly on the page.

questions.question: Which tag pair encloses the main visible content of an HTML document?
questions.explanation: The <body> tags contain the visible content of the HTML document displayed in the browser.

questions.question: To view your created HTML file, what do you need besides the file itself?
questions.explanation: An internet browser is needed to render and display the HTML file.
